author: Staff Reporter
text:
Demanding the arrest of the accused in a case related to murder of two labourers, villagers blocked the Edappadi – Jalakandapuram road here on Saturday.

C. Annadurai (45) and Mani (55), both of Erupali Pudur village in Edappadi, were found missing on January 17.

Inquiries revealed that N. Arthanari (36) of the same village mixed poison in the liquor that was consumed by Annadurai and Mani. Arthanari informed his brother N. Palanisamy (39) about the incident and the two removed the stem and roots of two palm trees and placed the bodies in it and dumped sand on the top of them.

The police recovered the bodies and arrested Palanisamy. Arthanari is still at large. He is an accused in a murder case and is out on conditional bail. On Saturday, villagers blocked the road and demanded the arrest of Arthanari. They said that Arthanari had murdered the two and is wandering in the village, but the police failed to arrest him.

Police pacified them and they withdrew their protest.

Police officers pacified them

and later they withdrew their protest
title: Villagers block road demanding arrest of murder case accused
